title: Human Development Index vs. Corruption Perception Index
subtitle: The Human Development Index (HDI) is a summary measure of key dimensions of human development: a long and healthy life, a good education, and a decent standard of living. A countryâ€™s Corruption Perceptions Index score (0 = most corrupt; 100 = least corrupt) averages expert surveys on public sector corruption, including bribery and misuse of office.
